meanings.definition: The quality of being appropriate or suitable.
meanings.sent1: The fittingness of his outfit for the job interview impressed the hiring manager.
meanings.sent2: She questioned the fittingness of wearing flip-flops to a formal event.
meanings.sent3: The fittingness of a penguin wearing a tuxedo to a party would surely turn heads.
meanings.sent4: The fittingness of a key in a lock symbolizes finding the perfect solution.
meanings.sent5: The fittingness of a puzzle piece clicking into place brought a sense of completion.

meanings.definition: The state of being fitting or proper.
meanings.sent1: The fittingness of her apology was evident in her sincere tone.
meanings.sent2: He questioned the fittingness of using a hammer to fix a delicate watch.
meanings.sent3: The fittingness of a clown performing brain surgery would be quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The fittingness of a square peg in a round hole illustrates a mismatch.
meanings.sent5: The fittingness of a plant thriving in the right soil shows perfect harmony.
